article.headline: Fairfield 68, Niagara 56
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Anthony Johnson scored 16 points and blocked four shots to lead Fairfield to a 68-56 win Sunday over Niagara. Michael Van Schaick added 14 points and Herbie Allen chipped in 10 for the Stags (8-15, 6-5 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference), who have won five in a row. Clif Brown posted his 10th double-double of the season for Niagara (11-11, 6-5), scoring 16 points and pulling down 14 rebounds. Charron Fisher added 14 for the Purple Eagles, who shot just 33 percent from the field, including 29 percent in the first half. The Stags held Niagara 18 points under their season scoring average. Fairfield used a 14-7 run to take a 27-16 lead with 5:24 remaining in the first half. But Niagara answered with a 9-2 run that cut the deficit to four points at 29-25. Fairfield scored the final five points of the half and led 34-25 at intermission. The Stags stretched that lead to 52-35 in the second half and never let Niagara back into the game.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
